perturbation.original_text:
6.1   IBM to MSL

      a)    MSL will invoice IBM [*] for all completed Products, after shipping             transactions have been processed by MSL. MSL will invoice IBM [*]             for all Integration work after shipping transactions have been             processed by MSL. For all other Services, MSL will invoice IBM [*].             IBM will pay MSL within [*] Days after receipt of an acceptable             invoice.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1   IBM to MSL

      a)    MSL will invoice IBM [*] for all completed Products, after shipping             transactions have been processed by MSL. MSL will invoice IBM [*]             for all Integration work after shipping transactions have been             processed by MSL. For all other Services, MSL will invoice IBM [*].             IBM will pay MSL within [*] Days after receipt of an acceptable             invoice.
perturbation.explanation: In this section, the original contract has a clause stating, "IBM will pay MSL within [*] Days after receipt of an acceptable invoice." However, the section is modified as follows:IBM will pay MSL within [*] Days after receipt of an acceptable invoice, but no later than 30 days after the invoice date, regardless of acceptance. The change causes confusion on the payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text:
6.2   MSL to IBM

      a)    MSL will pay IBM within [*] Days of receipt of an acceptable invoice             from IBM.

            IBM may offset any amounts owed IBM by MSL against any amounts owed             MSL by IBM under this Agreement, upon written approval of MSL             provided any such debts have been generated under this Agreement
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2   MSL to IBM

      a)    MSL will pay IBM within [*] Days of receipt of an acceptable invoice             from IBM.

            IBM may offset any amounts owed IBM by MSL against any amounts owed             MSL by IBM under this Agreement, without written approval of MSL provided any such debts have been generated under this Agreement
perturbation.explanation: In this section, the original contract has a clause stating, "IBM may offset any amounts owed IBM by MSL against any amounts owed MSL by IBM under this Agreement, upon written approval of MSL provided any such debts have been generated under this Agreement" However, the section is modified as follows: IBM may offset any amounts owed IBM by MSL against any amounts owed MSL by IBM under this Agreement, without written approval of MSL provided any such debts have been generated under this Agreement. The change removes the requirement for written approval.

perturbation.original_text:
The parties expressly waive any right to a jury trail regarding disputes

      related to this Agreement. Any legal or other action related to a breach
      of this Agreement must be commenced no later than [*] years from the date
      of the breach in a court sited within the State of New York.
perturbation.changed_text:
The parties expressly waive any right to a jury trail regarding disputes

      related to this Agreement. Any legal or other action related to a breach
      of this Agreement must be commenced no later than [*] year from the date
      of the breach in a court sited outside of the State of New York.
perturbation.explanation: In this section, the original contract has a clause stating, "Any legal or other action related to a breach of this Agreement must be commenced no later than [*] years from the date of the breach in a court sited within the State of New York." However, the section is modified as follows: Any legal or other action related to a breach of this Agreement must be commenced no later than [*] year from the date of the breach in a court sited outside of the State of New York. The change causes confusion on the time limit for actions.
